intro: Tordylium apulum, commonly known as the white-flowered tordylium, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a small, evergreen shrub native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The fruits are small, fleshy berries that contain several seeds.
